verses.verse: Woe <WH1945> to you that spoil, <WH7703> and you were not spoiled; <WH7703> and deal treacherously, <WH898> and they dealt not treacherously <WH898> with you! when you shall cease <WH8552> to spoil, <WH7703> you shall be spoiled; <WH7703> and when you shall make an end <WH5239> to deal treacherously, <WH898> they shall deal treacherously <WH898> with you.

O LORD, <WH3068> be gracious <WH2603> to us; we have waited <WH6960> for you: be you their arm <WH2220> every morning, <WH1242> our salvation <WH3444> also <WH637> in the time <WH6256> of trouble. <WH6869>
At the noise <WH6963> of the tumult <WH1995> the people <WH5971> fled; <WH5074> at the lifting <WH7427> up of yourself the nations <WH1471> were scattered. <WH5310>
And your spoil <WH7998> shall be gathered <WH622> like the gathering <WH625> of the caterpillar: <WH2625> as the running <WH4944> to and fro of locusts <WH1357> shall he run <WH8264> on them.
The LORD <WH3068> is exalted; <WH7682> for he dwells <WH7931> on high: <WH4791> he has filled <WH4390> Zion <WH6726> with judgment <WH4941> and righteousness. <WH6666>

And wisdom <WH2451> and knowledge <WH1847> shall be the stability <WH530> of your times, <WH6256> and strength <WH2633> of salvation: <WH3444> the fear <WH3374> of the LORD <WH3068> is his treasure. <WH214>
Behold, <WH2005> their valiant <WH691> ones shall cry <WH6817> without: <WH2351> the ambassadors <WH4397> of peace <WH7965> shall weep <WH1058> bitterly. <WH4751>

The highways <WH4546> lie waste, <WH8074> the wayfaring <WH5674> <WH734> man ceases: <WH7673> he has broken <WH6565> the covenant, <WH1285> he has despised <WH3988> the cities, <WH5892> he regards <WH2803> no <WH3808> man. <WH582>

The earth <WH776> mourns <WH56> and languishes: <WH535> Lebanon <WH3844> is ashamed <WH2659> and hewn <WH7060> down: Sharon <WH8289> is like a wilderness; <WH6160> and Bashan <WH1316> and Carmel <WH3760> shake <WH5287> off their fruits.
Now <WH6258> will I rise, <WH6965> said <WH559> the LORD; <WH3068> now <WH6258> will I be exalted; <WH7311> now <WH6258> will I lift <WH5375> up myself.
You shall conceive <WH2029> chaff, <WH2842> you shall bring <WH3205> forth <WH3205> stubble: <WH7179> your breath, <WH7307> as fire, <WH784> shall devour <WH398> you.
And the people <WH5971> shall be as the burnings <WH4955> of lime: <WH7875> as thorns <WH6975> cut <WH3683> up shall they be burned <WH3341> in the fire. <WH784>
Hear, <WH8085> you that are far <WH7350> off, what <WH834> I have done; <WH6213> and, you that are near, <WH7138> acknowledge <WH3045> my might. <WH1369>

The sinners <WH2400> in Zion <WH6726> are afraid; <WH6342> fearfulness <WH7461> has surprised <WH270> the hypocrites. <WH120> <WH2611> Who <WH4310> among us shall dwell <WH1481> with the devouring <WH398> fire? <WH784> who <WH4310> among us shall dwell <WH1481> with everlasting <WH5769> burnings? <WH4168>

He that walks <WH1980> righteously, <WH6666> and speaks <WH1696> uprightly; <WH4339> he that despises <WH3988> the gain <WH1214> of oppressions, <WH4642> that shakes <WH5287> his hands <WH3709> from holding <WH8551> of bribes, <WH7810> that stops <WH331> his ears <WH241> from hearing <WH8085> of blood, <WH1818> and shuts <WH6105> his eyes <WH5869> from seeing <WH7200> evil; <WH7451>

He shall dwell <WH7931> on high: <WH4791> his place of defense <WH4869> shall be the munitions <WH4679> of rocks: <WH5553> bread <WH3899> shall be given <WH5414> him; his waters <WH4325> shall be sure. <WH539>
Your eyes <WH5869> shall see <WH2372> the king <WH4428> in his beauty: <WH3308> they shall behold <WH7200> the land <WH776> that is very <WH4801> far <WH4801> off.

Your heart <WH3820> shall meditate <WH1897> terror. <WH367> Where <WH346> is the scribe? <WH5608> where <WH346> is the receiver? <WH8254> where <WH346> is he that counted <WH5608> the towers? <WH4026>

You shall not see <WH7200> a fierce <WH3267> people, <WH5971> a people <WH5971> of a deeper <WH6012> speech <WH8193> than you can perceive; <WH8085> of a stammering <WH3932> tongue, <WH3956> that you can not understand. <WH998>

Look <WH2372> on Zion, <WH6726> the city <WH7151> of our solemnities: <WH4150> your eyes <WH5869> shall see <WH7200> Jerusalem <WH3389> a quiet <WH7600> habitation, <WH5116> a tabernacle <WH168> that shall not be taken <WH6813> down; not one of the stakes <WH3489> thereof shall ever <WH5331> be removed, <WH5265> neither <WH1077> shall any <WH3605> of the cords <WH2256> thereof be broken. <WH5423>

But there <WH8033> the glorious <WH117> LORD <WH3068> will be to us a place <WH4725> of broad <WH7338> <WH3027> rivers <WH5103> and streams; <WH2975> wherein shall go <WH3212> no <WH1077> galley <WH590> with oars, <WH7885> neither <WH3808> shall gallant <WH117> ship <WH6716> pass <WH5674> thereby.
For the LORD <WH3068> is our judge, <WH8199> the LORD <WH3068> is our lawgiver, <WH2710> the LORD <WH3068> is our king; <WH4428> he will save <WH3467> us.

Your tacklings <WH2256> are loosed; <WH5203> they could not well <WH3651> strengthen <WH2388> their mast, <WH8650> they could not spread <WH6566> the sail: <WH5251> then <WH227> is the prey <WH5706> of a great <WH4766> spoil <WH7998> divided; <WH2505> the lame <WH6455> take <WH962> the prey. <WH957>
And the inhabitant <WH7934> shall not say, <WH559> I am sick: <WH2470> the people <WH5971> that dwell <WH3427> therein shall be forgiven <WH5375> their iniquity. <WH5771>
